'''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
' CalendarForm
' Developed by Trevor Eyre
' <PRESIDIO_ANONYMIZED_EMAIL_ADDRESS>
' v1.5.2 - 1.7.2016
'
' This custom date picker can be used by importing the CalendarForm.frm file into
' your VBA project. It is called exclusively through the GetDate function. For
' instructions on how to call on the CalendarForm, skip to the GetDate function
' documentation after the Global Variables section.
'''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''


'''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
' Contributors
'
' Graham Mayor, <PRESIDIO_ANONYMIZED_EMAIL_ADDRESS>, www.gmayor.com
'   -Fix for userform sizing incorrectly in Word 2013
'
' Greg Maxey, <PRESIDIO_ANONYMIZED_EMAIL_ADDRESS>, gregmaxey.mvps.org/word_tips.htm
'   -Fix for leap year bug on years divisible by 100
'   -Moved all initialization code to separate sub to simplify GetDate function
'   -Various code reorganization and optimizations
'
' Marc Meketon, <PRESIDIO_ANONYMIZED_EMAIL_ADDRESS>
'   -Fully qualify "Control" declarations as "MSForms.Control" for compatibility
'       with Access
'''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''


'''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
' Overview
'

Option Explicit

Public Enum calDayOfWeek
    Sunday = 1
    Monday = 2
    Tuesday = 3
    Wednesday = 4
    Thursday = 5
    Friday = 6
    Saturday = 7
End Enum

Public Enum calFirstWeekOfYear      'Controls how the week numbers are calculated and displayed
    FirstJan1 = 1                   'The week with January 1st is always counted as week 1
    FirstFourDays = 2               'The first week in January that has at least four days in it is
                                        'counted as week 1. This calculation will change depending
                                        'on the setting used for first day of the week. The ISO
                                        'standard is calculating week 1 as the first week in January
                                        'with four days with Monday being the first day of the week.
    FirstFullWeek = 3               'The first week in January with a full week is counted as week 1.
                                        'Like the FirstFourDays setting, this calculation will change
                                        'depending on the first day of the week used.
End Enum

Private UserformEventsEnabled As Boolean    'Controls userform events
Private DateOut As Date                     'The date returned from the CalendarForm
Private SelectedDateIn As Date              'The initial selected date, as well as the date currently selected by the
                                                'user if the Okay button is enabled
Private OkayEnabled As Boolean              'Stores whether Okay button is enabled
Private TodayEnabled As Boolean             'Stores whether Today button is enabled
Private MinDate As Date                     'Minimum date set by user
Private MaxDate As Date                     'Maximum date set by user
Private cmbYearMin As Long                  'Current lower bounds of year combobox. Not necessarily restricted to this min
Private cmbYearMax As Long                  'Current upper bounds of year combobox. Not necessarily restricted to this max
Private StartWeek As VbDayOfWeek            'First day of week in calendar
Private WeekOneOfYear As VbFirstWeekOfYear  'First week of year when setting week numbers
Private HoverControlName As String          'Name of the date label that is currently being hovered over. Used when returning
                                                'the hovered control to its original color
Private HoverControlColor As Long           'Original color of the date label that is currently being hovered over
Private RatioToResize As Double             'Ratio to resize elements of userform. This is set by the DateFontSize argument
                                                'in the GetDate function
Private bgDateColor As Long                 'Color of date label backgrounds
Private bgDateHoverColor As Long            'Color of date label backgrounds when hovering over
Private bgDateSelectedColor As Long         'Color of selected date label background
Private lblDateColor As Long                'Font color of date labels
Private lblDatePrevMonthColor As Long       'Font color of trailing month date labels
Private lblDateTodayColor As Long           'Font color of today's date
Private lblDateSatColor As Long             'Font color of Saturday date labels
Private lblDateSunColor As Long             'Font color of Sunday date labels

Public Function GetDate(Optional SelectedDate As Date = 0, _
    Optional FirstDayOfWeek As calDayOfWeek = Sunday, _
    Optional MinimumDate As Date = 0, _
    Optional MaximumDate As Date = 0, _
    Optional RangeOfYears As Long = 10, _
    Optional DateFontSize As Long = 9, _
    Optional TodayButton As Boolean = False, Optional OkayButton As Boolean = False, _
    Optional ShowWeekNumbers As Boolean = False, Optional FirstWeekOfYear As calFirstWeekOfYear = FirstJan1, _
    Optional PositionTop As Long = -5, Optional PositionLeft As Long = -5, _
    Optional BackgroundColor As Long = 16777215, _
    Optional HeaderColor As Long = 15658734, _
    Optional HeaderFontColor As Long = 0, _
    Optional SubHeaderColor As Long = 16448250, _
    Optional SubHeaderFontColor As Long = 8553090, _
    Optional DateColor As Long = 16777215, _
    Optional DateFontColor As Long = 0, _
    Optional SaturdayFontColor As Long = 0, _
    Optional SundayFontColor As Long = 0, _
    Optional DateBorder As Boolean = False, Optional DateBorderColor As Long = 15658734, _
    Optional DateSpecialEffect As fmSpecialEffect = fmSpecialEffectFlat, _
    Optional DateHoverColor As Long = 15658734, _
    Optional DateSelectedColor As Long = 14277081, _
    Optional TrailingMonthFontColor As Long = 12566463, _
    Optional TodayFontColor As Long = 15773696) As Date
    
    'Set global variables
    DateFontSize = Max(DateFontSize, 9) 'Font size cannot be below 9
    OkayEnabled = OkayButton
    TodayEnabled = TodayButton
    RatioToResize = DateFontSize / 9
    bgDateColor = DateColor
    lblDateColor = DateFontColor
    lblDateSatColor = SaturdayFontColor
    lblDateSunColor = SundayFontColor
    bgDateHoverColor = DateHoverColor
    bgDateSelectedColor = DateSelectedColor
    lblDatePrevMonthColor = TrailingMonthFontColor
    lblDateTodayColor = TodayFontColor
    StartWeek = FirstDayOfWeek
    WeekOneOfYear = FirstWeekOfYear
    
    'Initialize userform
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    Call InitializeUserform(SelectedDate, MinimumDate, MaximumDate, RangeOfYears, PositionTop, PositionLeft, _
        DateFontSize, ShowWeekNumbers, BackgroundColor, HeaderColor, HeaderFontColor, SubHeaderColor, _
        SubHeaderFontColor, DateBorder, DateBorderColor, DateSpecialEffect)
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
    
    'Show userform, return selected date, and unload
    Me.Show
    GetDate = DateOut
    Unload Me
End Function

Private Sub InitializeUserform(SelectedDate As Date, MinimumDate As Date, MaximumDate As Date, _
    RangeOfYears As Long, _
    PositionTop As Long, PositionLeft As Long, _
    SizeFont As Long, bWeekNumbers As Boolean, _
    BackgroundColor As Long, _
    HeaderColor As Long, _
    HeaderFontColor As Long, _
    SubHeaderColor As Long, _
    SubHeaderFontColor As Long, _
    DateBorder As Boolean, DateBorderColor As Long, _
    DateSpecialEffect As fmSpecialEffect)
    
    Dim TempDate As Date                        'Used to set selected date, if none has been provided
    Dim SelectedYear As Long                    'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long                   'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long                     'Day of seledcted date (if applicable)
    Dim TempDayOfWeek As Long                   'Used to set day labels in subheader
    Dim BorderSpacing As Double                 'Padding between the outermost elements of userform and edge of userform
    Dim HeaderDefaultFontSize As Long           'Default font size of the header labels (month and year)
    Dim bgHeaderDefaultHeight As Double         'Default height of the background behind header labels
    Dim lblMonthYearDefaultHeight As Double     'Default height of the month and year header labels
    Dim scrlMonthDefaultHeight As Double        'Default height of the month scroll bar
    Dim bgDayLabelsDefaultHeight As Double      'Default height of the background behind the subheader day of week labels
    Dim bgDateDefaultHeight As Double           'Default height of the background behind each date label
    Dim bgDateDefaultWidth As Double            'Default width of the background behind each date label
    Dim lblDateDefaultHeight As Double          'Default height of each date label
    Dim cmdButtonDefaultHeight As Double        'Default height of Today and Okay command buttons
    Dim cmdButtonDefaultWidth As Double         'Default width of Today and Okay command buttons
    Dim cmdButtonsCombinedWidth As Double       'Combined width of Today and Okay buttons. Used to center on userform
    Dim cmdButtonsMaxHeight As Double           'Maximum height of command buttons and month scroll bar
    Dim cmdButtonsMaxWidth As Double            'Maximum width of command buttons
    Dim cmdButtonsMaxFontSize As Long           'Maximum font size of command buttons
    Dim bgControl As MSForms.Control            'Stores current date label background in loop to initialize various settings
    Dim lblControl As MSForms.Control           'Stores current date label in loop to initialize various settings
    Dim HeightOffset As Double                  'Difference between form height and inside height, to account for toolbar
    Dim i As Long                               'Used for loops
    Dim j As Long                               'Used for loops
    
    'Initialize default values
    BorderSpacing = 6 * RatioToResize
    HeaderDefaultFontSize = 11
    bgHeaderDefaultHeight = 30
    lblMonthYearDefaultHeight = 13.5
    scrlMonthDefaultHeight = 18
    bgDayLabelsDefaultHeight = 18
    bgDateDefaultHeight = 18
    bgDateDefaultWidth = 18
    lblDateDefaultHeight = 10.5
    cmdButtonDefaultHeight = 24
    cmdButtonDefaultWidth = 60
    cmdButtonsMaxHeight = 36
    cmdButtonsMaxWidth = 90
    cmdButtonsMaxFontSize = 14

    If MinimumDate <= 0 Then
        MinDate = CDate("1/1/1900")
    Else
        MinDate = MinimumDate
    End If
    If MaximumDate = 0 Then
        MaxDate = CDate("12/31/9999")
    Else
        MaxDate = MaximumDate
    End If
    If MaxDate < MinDate Then MaxDate = MinDate
    
    'If today's date falls outside min/max, make sure Today button is disabled
    If Date < MinDate Or Date > MaxDate Then TodayEnabled = False

    'Initialize userform position. Initial value of top and left is -5. Check
    'this value to see if a different value has been passed. If not, position
    'to CenterOwner. Must set both top and left positions to override center position
    If PositionTop <> -5 And PositionLeft <> -5 Then
        Me.StartUpPosition = 0
        Me.Top = PositionTop
        Me.Left = PositionLeft
    Else
        Me.StartUpPosition = 1
    End If
    
    With bgHeader
        .Height = bgHeaderDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        'The header width depends on whether week numbers are visible or not
        If bWeekNumbers Then
            .Width = 8 * (bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize) + BorderSpacing
        Else
            .Width = 7 * (bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize)
        End If
        .Left = BorderSpacing
        .Top = BorderSpacing
    End With

    With scrlMonth
        .Width = bgHeader.Width - (2 * BorderSpacing)
        .Left = bgHeader.Left + BorderSpacing
        .Height = scrlMonthDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        If .Height > cmdButtonsMaxHeight Then .Height = cmdButtonsMaxHeight
        .Top = bgHeader.Top + ((bgHeader.Height - .Height) / 2)
    End With

    With bgScrollCover
        .Height = scrlMonth.Height
        .Width = scrlMonth.Width - 25 '25 is the width of the actual scroll buttons,
                                      'which need to remain visible
        .Left = scrlMonth.Left + 12.5
        .Top = scrlMonth.Top
    End With

    With lblMonth
        .AutoSize = False
        .Height = lblMonthYearDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        .Font.Size = HeaderDefaultFontSize * RatioToResize
        .Top = bgScrollCover.Top + ((bgScrollCover.Height - .Height) / 2)
    End With
    With lblYear
        .AutoSize = False
        .Height = lblMonthYearDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        .Font.Size = HeaderDefaultFontSize * RatioToResize
        .Top = bgScrollCover.Top + ((bgScrollCover.Height - .Height) / 2)
    End With
    cmbMonth.Top = lblMonth.Top + (lblMonth.Height - cmbMonth.Height)
    cmbYear.Top = lblYear.Top + (lblYear.Height - cmbYear.Height)

    With bgDayLabels
        .Height = bgDayLabelsDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        'The width depends on whether week numbers are visible or not
        If bWeekNumbers Then
            .Width = 8 * (bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize) + BorderSpacing
        Else
            .Width = 7 * (bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize)
        End If
        .Left = BorderSpacing
        .Top = bgHeader.Top + bgHeader.Height
    End With
    'Week number subheader label
    If Not bWeekNumbers Then
        lblWk.Visible = False
    Else
        With lblWk
            .AutoSize = False
            .Height = lblDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            .Font.Size = SizeFont
            .Width = bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
            .Top = bgDayLabels.Top + ((bgDayLabels.Height - .Height) / 2)
            .Left = BorderSpacing
        End With
    End If
    'Day of week subheader labels
    For i = 1 To 7
        With Me("lblDay" & CStr(i))
            .AutoSize = False
            .Height = lblDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            .Font.Size = SizeFont
            .Width = bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
            .Top = bgDayLabels.Top + ((bgDayLabels.Height - .Height) / 2)
            If i = 1 Then

                If bWeekNumbers Then
                    .Left = lblWk.Left + lblWk.Width + BorderSpacing
                Else
                    .Left = BorderSpacing
                End If
            Else 'All other labels placed directly next to preceding label
                .Left = Me("lblDay" & CStr(i - 1)).Left + Me("lblDay" & CStr(i - 1)).Width
            End If
        End With
    Next i
    
    For i = 1 To 6 'Rows
        'First set position and visibility of week number label
        If Not bWeekNumbers Then
            Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).Visible = False
        Else
            With Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i))
                .AutoSize = False
                .Height = lblDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
                .Font.Size = SizeFont
                .Width = bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
                .Left = BorderSpacing
                If i = 1 Then
                    .Top = bgDayLabels.Top + bgDayLabels.Height + (((bgDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize) - .Height) / 2)
                Else
                    .Top = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i - 1) & "1").Top + Me("bgDate" & CStr(i - 1) & "1").Height + (((bgDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize) - .Height) / 2)
                End If
            End With
        End If
        
        For j = 1 To 7
            Set bgControl = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))
            Set lblControl = Me("lblDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))

            With bgControl
                .Height = bgDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
                .Width = bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
                If j = 1 Then

                    If bWeekNumbers Then
                        .Left = Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).Left + Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).Width + BorderSpacing
                    Else
                        .Left = BorderSpacing
                    End If
                Else 'All other labels placed directly next to preceding label in row
                    .Left = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j - 1)).Left + Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j - 1)).Width
                End If
                If i = 1 Then
                    .Top = bgDayLabels.Top + bgDayLabels.Height
                Else
                    .Top = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i - 1) & CStr(j)).Top + Me("bgDate" & CStr(i - 1) & CStr(j)).Height
                End If
            End With
            'Size and position actual date label
            With lblControl
                .AutoSize = False
                .Height = lblDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
                .Font.Size = SizeFont
                .Width = bgControl.Width
                .Left = bgControl.Left
                .Top = bgControl.Top + ((bgControl.Height - .Height) / 2)
            End With
        Next j
    Next i
    
    frameCalendar.Width = bgDate67.Left + bgDate67.Width + BorderSpacing

    If Me.InsideWidth < (frameCalendar.Left + frameCalendar.Width) Then
        Me.Width = Me.Width + ((frameCalendar.Left + frameCalendar.Width) - Me.InsideWidth)
    End If

    If Not OkayEnabled Then
        cmdOkay.Visible = False
        lblSelection.Visible = False
        lblSelectionDate.Visible = False
    Else

        With cmdOkay
            .Visible = True
            .Height = cmdButtonDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            If .Height > cmdButtonsMaxHeight Then .Height = cmdButtonsMaxHeight
            .Width = cmdButtonDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
            If .Width > cmdButtonsMaxWidth Then .Width = cmdButtonsMaxWidth
            If SizeFont > cmdButtonsMaxFontSize Then
                .Font.Size = cmdButtonsMaxFontSize
            Else
                .Font.Size = SizeFont
            End If
            .Top = bgDate61.Top + bgDate61.Height + bgDayLabels.Height + BorderSpacing
        End With
        'The "Selection" label
        With lblSelection
            .Visible = True
            .AutoSize = False
            .Height = lblMonthYearDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            .Width = frameCalendar.Width
            .Font.Size = HeaderDefaultFontSize * RatioToResize
            .AutoSize = True
            .Top = (bgDate61.Top + bgDate61.Height) + ((bgDayLabels.Height + BorderSpacing - .Height) / 2)
        End With
        'The actual selected date label
        With lblSelectionDate
            .Visible = True
            .AutoSize = False
            .Height = lblMonthYearDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            .Width = frameCalendar.Width - lblSelection.Width
            .Font.Size = HeaderDefaultFontSize * RatioToResize
            .Top = lblSelection.Top
        End With
    End If

    If Not TodayEnabled Then
        cmdToday.Visible = False
    Else
        With cmdToday
            .Visible = True
            .Height = cmdButtonDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            If .Height > cmdButtonsMaxHeight Then .Height = cmdButtonsMaxHeight
            .Width = cmdButtonDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
            If .Width > cmdButtonsMaxWidth Then .Width = cmdButtonsMaxWidth
            If SizeFont > cmdButtonsMaxFontSize Then
                .Font.Size = cmdButtonsMaxFontSize
            Else
                .Font.Size = SizeFont
            End If
        End With
    End If
    
    If OkayEnabled And TodayEnabled Then 'Both buttons enabled.
        cmdToday.Top = cmdOkay.Top
        cmdButtonsCombinedWidth = cmdToday.Width + cmdOkay.Width
        cmdToday.Left = ((frameCalendar.Width - cmdButtonsCombinedWidth) / 2) - (BorderSpacing / 2)
        cmdOkay.Left = cmdToday.Left + cmdToday.Width + BorderSpacing
    ElseIf OkayEnabled Then 'Only Okay button enabled
        cmdOkay.Left = (frameCalendar.Width - cmdOkay.Width) / 2
    ElseIf TodayEnabled Then 'Only Today button enabled
        cmdToday.Top = bgDate61.Top + bgDate61.Height + BorderSpacing
        cmdToday.Left = (frameCalendar.Width - cmdToday.Width) / 2
    End If
    
    HeightOffset = Me.Height - Me.InsideHeight
    If OkayEnabled Then
        frameCalendar.Height = cmdOkay.Top + cmdOkay.Height + HeightOffset + BorderSpacing
    ElseIf TodayEnabled Then 'Only Today button enabled
        frameCalendar.Height = cmdToday.Top + cmdToday.Height + HeightOffset + BorderSpacing
    Else 'Neither button enabled
        frameCalendar.Height = bgDate61.Top + bgDate61.Height + HeightOffset + BorderSpacing
    End If
    
    If Me.InsideHeight < (frameCalendar.Top + frameCalendar.Height) Then
        Me.Height = Me.Height + ((frameCalendar.Top + frameCalendar.Height) - Me.InsideHeight - HeightOffset)
    End If
    
    If SelectedDate > 0 Then
        If SelectedDate < MinDate Then
            SelectedDate = MinDate
        ElseIf SelectedDate > MaxDate Then
            SelectedDate = MaxDate
        End If
        SelectedDateIn = SelectedDate
        SelectedYear = Year(SelectedDateIn)
        SelectedMonth = Month(SelectedDateIn)
        SelectedDay = Day(SelectedDateIn)
        Call SetSelectionLabel(SelectedDateIn)
    Else 'No SelectedDate provided, default to today's date
        cmdOkay.Enabled = False
        TempDate = Date
        If TempDate < MinDate Then
            TempDate = MinDate
        ElseIf TempDate > MaxDate Then
            TempDate = MaxDate
        End If
        SelectedYear = Year(TempDate)
        SelectedMonth = Month(TempDate)
        SelectedDay = 0 'Don't want to highlight a 'selected date,' since user supplied no date
        Call SetSelectionLabel(Empty)
    End If
    
    Call SetMonthCombobox(SelectedYear, SelectedMonth)
    scrlMonth.value = SelectedMonth
    cmbYearMin = SelectedYear - RangeOfYears
    cmbYearMax = SelectedYear + RangeOfYears
    If cmbYearMin < Year(MinDate) Then
        cmbYearMin = Year(MinDate)
    End If
    If cmbYearMax > Year(MaxDate) Then
        cmbYearMax = Year(MaxDate)
    End If
    For i = cmbYearMin To cmbYearMax
        cmbYear.AddItem i
    Next i
    cmbYear.value = SelectedYear
    
    'Set userform colors and effects
    Me.BackColor = BackgroundColor
    frameCalendar.BackColor = BackgroundColor
    bgHeader.BackColor = HeaderColor
    bgScrollCover.BackColor = HeaderColor
    lblMonth.ForeColor = HeaderFontColor
    lblYear.ForeColor = HeaderFontColor
    lblSelection.ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
    lblSelectionDate.ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
    bgDayLabels.BackColor = SubHeaderColor
    For i = 1 To 7
        Me("lblDay" & CStr(i)).ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
    Next i
    If bWeekNumbers Then
        lblWk.ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
        For i = 1 To 6
            Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
        Next i
    End If
    For i = 1 To 6
        For j = 1 To 7
            With Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))
                If DateBorder Then
                    .BorderStyle = fmBorderStyleSingle
                    .BorderColor = DateBorderColor
                End If
                .SpecialEffect = DateSpecialEffect
            End With
        Next j
    Next i
    
    TempDayOfWeek = StartWeek
    For i = 1 To 7
        Me("lblDay" & CStr(i)).Caption = Choose(TempDayOfWeek, "Su", "Mo", "Tu", "We", "Th", "Fr", "Sa")
        TempDayOfWeek = TempDayOfWeek + 1
        If TempDayOfWeek = 8 Then TempDayOfWeek = 1
    Next i
            
    Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
End Sub

Private Sub cmdOkay_Click()
    DateOut = SelectedDateIn
    Me.Hide
End Sub

Private Sub cmdToday_Click()
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long           'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long            'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long             'Day of selected date, if applicable
    Dim TodayDate As Date               'Today's date
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    SelectedDay = 0
    TodayDate = Date
    
    If OkayEnabled Then
        cmdOkay.Enabled = True
        SelectedDateIn = TodayDate
        Call SetSelectionLabel(TodayDate)
        SelectedDay = Day(TodayDate)
    End If
    
    SelectedMonth = Month(TodayDate)
    SelectedYear = Year(TodayDate)
    SelectedDay = GetSelectedDay(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    scrlMonth.value = SelectedMonth
    
    Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
End Sub

Private Sub ClickControl(ctrl As MSForms.Control)
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long           'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long            'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long             'Day of selected date
    Dim SelectedDate As Date            'Date that the user has selected
    Dim RowIndex As Long                'Row index of the clicked date label
    Dim ColumnIndex As Long             'Column index of the clicked date label
    
    SelectedMonth = scrlMonth.value
    SelectedYear = cmbYear.value
    
    RowIndex = CLng(Left(Right(ctrl.Name, 2), 1))
    ColumnIndex = CLng(Right(ctrl.Name, 1))
    SelectedDay = CLng(ctrl.Caption)
    
    If RowIndex = 1 And SelectedDay > 7 Then
        SelectedMonth = SelectedMonth - 1
        'Handle January
        If SelectedMonth = 0 Then
            SelectedYear = SelectedYear - 1
            SelectedMonth = 12
        End If
    
    ElseIf RowIndex >= 5 And SelectedDay < 20 Then
        SelectedMonth = SelectedMonth + 1
        'Handle December
        If SelectedMonth = 13 Then
            SelectedYear = SelectedYear + 1
            SelectedMonth = 1
        End If
    End If
    
    SelectedDate = DateSerial(SelectedYear, SelectedMonth, SelectedDay)
    
    If Not OkayEnabled Then
        DateOut = SelectedDate
        Me.Hide
    Else
        UserformEventsEnabled = False
            cmdOkay.Enabled = True
            SelectedDateIn = SelectedDate
            scrlMonth.value = SelectedMonth
            Call SetSelectionLabel(SelectedDate)
            Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
            Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
        UserformEventsEnabled = True
    End If
End Sub

Private Sub HoverControl(ctrl As MSForms.Control)
    If HoverControlName <> vbNullString Then
        Me.Controls(HoverControlName).BackColor = HoverControlColor
    End If
    HoverControlName = ctrl.Name
    HoverControlColor = ctrl.BackColor
    ctrl.BackColor = bgDateHoverColor
End Sub

Private Sub lblMonth_Click()
    cmbMonth.DropDown
End Sub
Private Sub lblYear_Click()
    cmbYear.DropDown
End Sub

Private Sub cmbMonth_Change()
    Call cmbMonthYearChange
End Sub
Private Sub cmbYear_Change()
    If Not UserformEventsEnabled Then Exit Sub
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    Call SetMonthCombobox(cmbYear.value, scrlMonth.value)
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
    
    Call cmbMonthYearChange
End Sub

Private Sub cmbMonthYearChange()
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long           'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long            'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long             'Day of selected date
    
    If Not UserformEventsEnabled Then Exit Sub
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    
    SelectedYear = cmbYear.value
    If SelectedYear = Year(MinDate) Then
        SelectedMonth = cmbMonth.ListIndex + Month(MinDate)
    Else
        SelectedMonth = cmbMonth.ListIndex + 1
    End If
    
    SelectedDay = GetSelectedDay(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    scrlMonth.value = SelectedMonth
    Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
End Sub

Private Sub scrlMonth_Change()
    Dim TempYear As Long        'Temporarily store selected year to test min and max dates
    Dim MinMonth As Long        'Sets lower limit of scroll bar
    Dim MaxMonth As Long        'Sets upper limit of scroll bar
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long   'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long    'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long     'Day of selected date
    
    If Not UserformEventsEnabled Then Exit Sub
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    
    MinMonth = 0
    MaxMonth = 13
    
    TempYear = cmbYear.value
    If TempYear = Year(MinDate) Then MinMonth = Month(MinDate)
    If TempYear = Year(MaxDate) Then MaxMonth = Month(MaxDate)
    
    If scrlMonth.value < MinMonth Then scrlMonth.value = scrlMonth.value + 1
    If scrlMonth.value > MaxMonth Then scrlMonth.value = scrlMonth.value - 1
    
    If scrlMonth.value = 0 Then
        scrlMonth.value = 12
        cmbYear.value = cmbYear.value - 1
        'If new year is outside range of combobox, add it to combobox
        If cmbYear.value < cmbYearMin Then
            cmbYear.AddItem cmbYear.value, 0
            cmbYearMin = cmbYear.value
        End If
        Call SetMonthCombobox(cmbYear.value, scrlMonth.value)

    ElseIf scrlMonth.value = 13 Then
        scrlMonth.value = 1
        cmbYear.value = cmbYear.value + 1

        If cmbYear.value > cmbYearMax Then
            cmbYear.AddItem cmbYear.value, cmbYear.ListCount
            cmbYearMax = cmbYear.value
        End If
        Call SetMonthCombobox(cmbYear.value, scrlMonth.value)
    End If
    
    SelectedMonth = scrlMonth.value
    SelectedYear = cmbYear.value
    SelectedDay = GetSelectedDay(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
End Sub

Private Sub SetMonthCombobox(YearIn As Long, MonthIn As Long)
    Dim YearMinDate As Long             'Year of the minimum date
    Dim YearMaxDate As Long             'Year of the maximum date
    Dim MonthMinDate As Long            'Month of the minimum date
    Dim MonthMaxDate As Long            'Month of the maximum date
    Dim i As Long                       'Used for looping
    
    YearMinDate = Year(MinDate)
    YearMaxDate = Year(MaxDate)
    MonthMinDate = Month(MinDate)
    MonthMaxDate = Month(MaxDate)
    cmbMonth.Clear

    If YearIn = YearMinDate And YearIn = YearMaxDate Then
        For i = MonthMinDate To MonthMaxDate
            cmbMonth.AddItem Choose(i, "January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December")
        Next i
        If MonthIn < MonthMinDate Then MonthIn = MonthMinDate
        If MonthIn > MonthMaxDate Then MonthIn = MonthMaxDate
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - MonthMinDate
    
    ElseIf YearIn = YearMinDate Then
        For i = MonthMinDate To 12
            cmbMonth.AddItem Choose(i, "January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December")
        Next i
        If MonthIn < MonthMinDate Then MonthIn = MonthMinDate
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - MonthMinDate
    
    ElseIf YearIn = YearMaxDate Then
        For i = 1 To MonthMaxDate
            cmbMonth.AddItem Choose(i, "January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December")
        Next i
        If MonthIn > MonthMaxDate Then MonthIn = MonthMaxDate
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - 1
    
    Else
        cmbMonth.List = Array("January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December")
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - 1
    End If

End Sub

Private Sub SetMonthYear(MonthIn As Long, YearIn As Long)
    Dim ExtraSpace As Double                'Space between month and year labels
    Dim CombinedLabelWidth As Double        'Combined width of both month and year labels
    
    ExtraSpace = 4 * RatioToResize
    
    If YearIn = Year(MinDate) Then
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - Month(MinDate)
    Else
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - 1
    End If
    cmbYear.value = YearIn

    With lblMonth
        .AutoSize = False
        .Width = frameCalendar.Width
        .Caption = cmbMonth.value
        .AutoSize = True
    End With
    With lblYear
        .AutoSize = False
        .Width = frameCalendar.Width
        .Caption = cmbYear.value
        .AutoSize = True
    End With
    
    CombinedLabelWidth = lblMonth.Width + lblYear.Width
    With lblMonth
        .Left = ((frameCalendar.Width - CombinedLabelWidth) / 2) - (ExtraSpace / 2)
    End With
    With lblYear
        .Left = lblMonth.Left + lblMonth.Width + ExtraSpace
    End With

    cmbMonth.Left = lblMonth.Left - (cmbMonth.Width - lblMonth.Width) - ExtraSpace - 2
    cmbYear.Left = lblYear.Left

    HoverControlName = vbNullString
End Sub

Private Sub SetDays(MonthIn As Long, YearIn As Long, Optional DayIn As Long)
    Dim PrevMonth As Long               'Month preceding selected month. Used for trailing dates
    Dim NextMonth As Long               'Month following selected month. Used for trailing dates
    Dim Today As Date                   'Today's date
    Dim TodayDay As Long                'Day number of today's date
    Dim StartDayOfWeek  As Long         'Stores the weekday number of the first day in selected month
    Dim LastDayOfMonth As Long          'Last day of the month
    Dim LastDayOfPrevMonth As Long      'Last day of preceding month. Used for trailing dates
    Dim CurrentDay As Long              'Tracks current day in the month while setting labels
    Dim TempCurrentDay As Long          'Tracks the current day for previous month without incrementing actual CurrentDay
    Dim WeekNumber As Long              'Stores week number for week number labels
    Dim StartDayOfWeekDate As Date      'Stores first date in the week. Used to calculate week numbers
    Dim SaturdayIndex As Long           'Column index of Saturdays. Used to set color of Saturday labels, if applicable
    Dim SundayIndex As Long             'Column index of Sundays
    Dim MinDay As Long                  'Stores lower limit of days if minimum date falls in selected month
    Dim MaxDay As Long                  'Stores upper limit of days if maximum date falls in selected month
    Dim PrevMonthMinDay As Long         'Stores lower limit of days if minimum date falls in preceding month
    Dim NextMonthMaxDay As Long         'Stores upper limit of days if maximum date falls in next month
    Dim lblControl As MSForms.Control   'Stores current date label while changing settings
    Dim bgControl As MSForms.Control    'Stores current date label background while changing settings
    Dim i As Long                       'Used for looping
    Dim j As Long                       'Used for looping
    
    MinDay = 0
    MaxDay = 32
    If YearIn = Year(MinDate) And MonthIn = Month(MinDate) Then MinDay = Day(MinDate)
    If YearIn = Year(MaxDate) And MonthIn = Month(MaxDate) Then MaxDay = Day(MaxDate)

    PrevMonth = MonthIn - 1
    If PrevMonth = 0 Then PrevMonth = 12
    NextMonth = MonthIn + 1
    If NextMonth = 13 Then NextMonth = 1

    PrevMonthMinDay = 0
    NextMonthMaxDay = 32
    If YearIn = Year(MinDate) And PrevMonth = Month(MinDate) Then PrevMonthMinDay = Day(MinDate)
    If YearIn = Year(MaxDate) And NextMonth = Month(MaxDate) Then NextMonthMaxDay = Day(MaxDate)

    LastDayOfMonth = Day(DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn + 1, 0))
    LastDayOfPrevMonth = Day(DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn, 0))
    StartDayOfWeek = Weekday(DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn, 1), StartWeek)
    If StartWeek = 1 Then SundayIndex = 1 Else SundayIndex = 9 - StartWeek
    SaturdayIndex = 8 - StartWeek

    Today = Date
    If YearIn = Year(Today) And MonthIn = Month(Today) Then
        TodayDay = Day(Today)
    Else
        TodayDay = 0
    End If

    CurrentDay = 1
    For i = 1 To 6 'Rows

        If StartDayOfWeek = 1 And i = 1 Then

            TempCurrentDay = CLng(LastDayOfPrevMonth - (StartDayOfWeek + 5))
            If PrevMonth <> 12 Then
                StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn, PrevMonth, TempCurrentDay)
            Else
                StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn - 1, PrevMonth, TempCurrentDay)
            End If
            
        ElseIf i = 1 Then
            StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn, 1)
        
        Else
            If CurrentDay <= LastDayOfMonth Then
                TempCurrentDay = CurrentDay
                StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn, TempCurrentDay)
           
            Else
                TempCurrentDay = CLng(CurrentDay - LastDayOfMonth)
                If NextMonth <> 1 Then
                    StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn, NextMonth, TempCurrentDay)
                Else
                    StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn + 1, NextMonth, TempCurrentDay)
                End If
            End If
        End If
        WeekNumber = DatePart("ww", StartDayOfWeekDate, StartWeek, WeekOneOfYear)

        If WeekNumber > 52 And TempCurrentDay > 25 Then
            WeekNumber = DatePart("ww", DateSerial(YearIn + 1, 1, 1), StartWeek, WeekOneOfYear)
        End If
        Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).Caption = WeekNumber
        
        For j = 1 To 7 'Columns
            Set lblControl = Me("lblDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))
            Set bgControl = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))
            With lblControl

                If StartDayOfWeek = 1 And i = 1 Then
                    'If minimum date is in current month, then previous month shouldn't be visible
                    If MinDay <> 0 Then
                        .Visible = False
                        bgControl.Visible = False
                    Else
                        TempCurrentDay = CLng(LastDayOfPrevMonth - (StartDayOfWeek + 6 - j))
                        'Make sure previous month dates don't go beyond minimum date
                        If TempCurrentDay < PrevMonthMinDay Then
                            .Visible = False
                            bgControl.Visible = False
                        Else
                            .Visible = True
                            bgControl.Visible = True
                            .ForeColor = lblDatePrevMonthColor
                            .Caption = CStr(TempCurrentDay)
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateColor
                        End If
                    End If
                    
                ElseIf i = 1 And j < StartDayOfWeek Then
                    'If minimum date is in current month, then previous month shouldn't be visible
                    If MinDay <> 0 Then
                        .Visible = False
                        bgControl.Visible = False
                    Else
                        TempCurrentDay = CLng(LastDayOfPrevMonth - (StartDayOfWeek - 1 - j))
                        'Make sure previous month dates don't go beyond minimum date
                        If TempCurrentDay < PrevMonthMinDay Then
                            .Visible = False
                            bgControl.Visible = False
                        Else
                            .Visible = True
                            .Enabled = True
                            bgControl.Visible = True
                            .ForeColor = lblDatePrevMonthColor
                            .Caption = CStr(TempCurrentDay)
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateColor
                        End If
                    End If

                ElseIf CurrentDay > LastDayOfMonth Then
                    If MaxDay <> 32 Then
                        .Visible = False
                        bgControl.Visible = False
                    Else
                        TempCurrentDay = CLng(CurrentDay - LastDayOfMonth)
                        If TempCurrentDay > NextMonthMaxDay Then
                            .Visible = False
                            bgControl.Visible = False
                        Else
                            .Visible = True
                            .Enabled = True
                            bgControl.Visible = True
                            .ForeColor = lblDatePrevMonthColor
                            .Caption = CStr(TempCurrentDay)
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateColor
                        End If
                    End If
                    CurrentDay = CurrentDay + 1
                    
                Else
                    If CurrentDay < MinDay Or CurrentDay > MaxDay Then
                        .Visible = True
                        .Enabled = False
                        bgControl.Visible = False
                    Else 'Within bounds. Enable and set colors
                        .Visible = True
                        .Enabled = True
                        bgControl.Visible = True
                        'Set text color
                        If CurrentDay = TodayDay Then
                            .ForeColor = lblDateTodayColor
                        ElseIf j = SaturdayIndex Then
                            .ForeColor = lblDateSatColor
                        ElseIf j = SundayIndex Then
                            .ForeColor = lblDateSunColor
                        Else
                            .ForeColor = lblDateColor
                        End If
                        
                        'Set background color
                        If CurrentDay = DayIn Then
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateSelectedColor
                        Else
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateColor
                        End If
                    End If
                    .Caption = CStr(CurrentDay)
                    CurrentDay = CurrentDay + 1
                End If
            End With
        Next j
    Next i
End Sub

Private Sub SetSelectionLabel(DateIn As Date)
    Dim CombinedLabelWidth As Double        'Combined width of both labels, used to center
    Dim ExtraSpace As Double                'Space between the two labels
    
    ExtraSpace = 3 * RatioToResize

    If DateIn = 0 Then
        lblSelectionDate.Caption = vbNullString
        lblSelection.Left = frameCalendar.Left + ((frameCalendar.Width - lblSelection.Width) / 2)
    Else 'A selection has been made. Set caption and center
        With lblSelectionDate
            .AutoSize = False
            .Width = frameCalendar.Width
            .Caption = Format(DateIn, "mm/dd/yyyy")
            .AutoSize = True
        End With
    
        CombinedLabelWidth = lblSelection.Width + lblSelectionDate.Width
        lblSelection.Left = ((frameCalendar.Width - CombinedLabelWidth) / 2) - (ExtraSpace / 2)
        lblSelectionDate.Left = lblSelection.Left + lblSelection.Width + ExtraSpace
    End If
End Sub

Private Function GetSelectedDay(MonthIn As Long, YearIn As Long) As Long
    GetSelectedDay = 0
    
    'Check if a selected date was provided by the user
    If SelectedDateIn <> 0 Then
        If MonthIn = Month(SelectedDateIn) And YearIn = Year(SelectedDateIn) Then
            GetSelectedDay = Day(SelectedDateIn)
        End If
    End If
End Function

Private Function Min(ParamArray values() As Variant) As Variant
   Dim minValue As Variant
   Dim value As Variant
   minValue = values(0)
   For Each value In values
       If value < minValue Then minValue = value
   Next
   Min = minValue
End Function
Private Function Max(ParamArray values() As Variant) As Variant
   Dim maxValue As Variant
   Dim value As Variant
   maxValue = values(0)
   For Each value In values
       If value > maxValue Then maxValue = value
   Next
   Max = maxValue
End Function

When I open the form, it shows Spetember 2014.
If I click on the button Today, I get an error 'Could not set the ListIndex property. Ivalid property value' on the line : cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - 1

The error 'Could not set the ListIndex property. Invalid property value.' occurs because the value being set to the ListIndex property of the `cmbMonth` combobox is out of range. 

To resolve this issue, you can add a check to ensure that the value being assigned to `cmbMonth.ListIndex` is within the valid range of the combobox items. 

Here's an updated version of the `cmbMonthYearChange` subroutine with the added check:

```VBA
Private Sub cmbMonthYearChange()
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long           'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long            'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long             'Day of selected date
    
    If Not UserformEventsEnabled Then Exit Sub
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    
    SelectedYear = cmbYear.value
    If SelectedYear = Year(MinDate) Then
        SelectedMonth = cmbMonth.ListIndex + Month(MinDate)
    Else
        SelectedMonth = cmbMonth.ListIndex + 1
    End If
    
    ' Check if the ListIndex falls in the valid range of the combobox
    If SelectedMonth >= 0 And SelectedMonth < cmbMonth.ListCount Then
        scrlMonth.value = SelectedMonth + 1
    End If
    
    Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
End Sub
```

By adding this check, you ensure that the ListIndex assignment is within the bounds of the combobox items, preventing the error from occurring. You can implement a similar check for other combobox ListIndex assignments if needed. 

Please try incorporating this modification and let me know if it resolves the issue.

how do i check py directory

To check the contents of a directory in Python, you can use the `os` module. Here's an example of how you can check the contents of a directory that contains Python files (`.py` files):

```python
import os

# Specify the directory path
directory_path = '/path/to/directory'

# Get the list of files in the directory
files = os.listdir(directory_path)

# Loop through the files and print out the Python files
for file in files:
    if file.endswith('.py'):
        print(file)

```

Replace `'/path/to/directory'` with the actual path to the directory you want to check. When you run this code, it will print out the names of all the Python files in that directory.
if i call python in cmd, how do i know in which directory this py is called from

In the command line, you can use the `os` module in Python to determine the current working directory from which the Python script is being executed. Here is an example of how you can achieve this:

```python
import os

# Get the current working directory
current_directory = os.getcwd()

print("Current Working Directory:", current_directory)
```

When you run the above code in a Python script, it will print out the current working directory from which the script is being executed. This can help you identify the directory from which the Python script is being called in the command line.
i have python in appdata and in program files. both are in path , how do i know which one is being called

If you have multiple installations of Python on your system and both are added to the PATH environment variable, you can determine which Python interpreter is being called by running the following command in the command line:

```bash
python --version
```

This command will display the version of the Python interpreter that is being called. The version number will indicate which Python installation, either in `AppData` or `Program Files`, is being used.

If you want to check the full path of the Python interpreter being called, you can use the following command:

```bash
where python
```

This command will display the full path to the Python interpreter that is being executed, which will help you determine the exact location of the Python installation.

Reverse engineering an .exe file to extract the source code is a complex process that requires knowledge of assembly language and reverse engineering. Here are some general steps for manual reverse engineering:

1. Open the .exe file in a hexadecimal editor: A hexadecimal editor allows you to view and modify data at a binary level. Open the .exe file in a hexadecimal editor to examine the file's structure and search for text strings that may reveal the code.

2. Analyze the assembly code: Use a debugger such as OllyDbg, x64dbg or IDA Pro to examine the code at an assembly level. This will allow you to trace the flow of the program and identify key functions that may contain important code.

3. Reconstruct the code: Use the information you have gathered from the previous steps to attempt to reconstruct the original source code. This involves analyzing the assembly code and attempting to translate it back into its original programming language. This process is very labor-intensive and may require significant expertise in programming and reverse engineering.

4. Test the reconstructed code: Once you have reconstructed the code, test it to ensure that it works as expected. This may involve running the code through a compiler to generate an executable file and testing it against the original application.

There is no macOS version called Ventura 13.3. It is likely that you mean macOS 10.13.3 (High Sierra). The version of Python installed by default on macOS High Sierra is Python 2.7.10.
what version of python is installed by default on macOS 13.3?

There is no macOS version called "macOS 13.3". The latest version of macOS as of July 2021 is macOS Big Sur 11.5, and the version of Python installed by default on macOS Big Sur is Python 2.7.16. Additionally, Python 3.8.2 is also included as an option for developers. However, it is recommended to install a more recent version of Python using a package manager like Homebrew or pyenv.
why does macos come with such an old version of python?

Apple ships macOS with an older version of Python (like Python 2.7) because some macOS system tools are still built with that version of python. Changing the version of Python preinstalled could potentially break some of the system tools or the native applications that depend on them.

In addition, Python is primarily used by developers, and not everyone who uses macOS is a developer. Providing a pre-installed version of Python may not be needed for non-developers, and the focus may be on providing an operating system that is user-friendly and easy to adopt for a wide range of users.

That being said, macOS does allow developers to use newer versions of Python, and even has Python 3 available as an option. It is also possible to use third-party package managers like Homebrew or pyenv to install a newer version of Python alongside the pre-installed version.
does macos come with java

macOS used to come with Java pre-installed as part of the operating system, but starting from macOS Catalina (10.15) and later versions, Apple no longer includes Java by default. Instead, if a user attempts to run a Java-based application, macOS will prompt the user to install Java from Oracle’s website. 

However, it's worth noting that this only applies to the Java runtime environment (JRE), which is used to run Java applications on a system. The Java development kit (JDK), which is used by developers to create Java applications, is not included with macOS, and developers will still have to download and install it separately from the Oracle website or through package managers like Homebrew.
what development languages does macos come with?

macOS comes with several programming languages pre-installed, including:

1. C and C++: macOS includes the Clang C/C++/Objective-C compiler and the LLVM compiler infrastructure.

2. Swift: Apple's programming language for iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS app development, which can be used for both front-end and back-end development.

3. Python: macOS comes with Python 2.7.x pre-installed, which is used by some system tools.

4. Ruby: macOS comes with Ruby 2.6.x pre-installed, which can be used for web development and scripting.

5. Perl: macOS comes with Perl 5.x pre-installed, which is often used for system administration and web development.

6. PHP: macOS includes PHP 7.x pre-installed, which is used for web development.

In addition to these languages, Xcode, Apple's integrated development environment (IDE), includes several more programming languages like Objective-C, Objective-C++, Java, and more.
does windows come with ruby, perl, or php?

No, Windows does not come with Ruby, Perl, or PHP pre-installed. Users can download and install these programming languages separately either by downloading them from the respective language's official website or by using package managers like Chocolatey, Scoop or WinGet. 

Additionally, Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) can be used to run Linux-based applications including Ruby, Perl, PHP, and other Linux packages.

I must replace strcpy_s in the line: strcpy_s(s, t2, driver_list::driver(jj).year); because of "Cannot find procedure entry point strcpy_s in dynamic link library msvcrt.dll".

The error message you're encountering suggests that the "strcpy_s" function is not available in the "msvcrt.dll" library, which is the Microsoft C Runtime Library. This issue typically occurs when using older versions of the C/C++ compilers and libraries.

One possible solution is to switch to a newer compiler or use a different library that supports the "strcpy_s" function. Alternatively, you can replace the "strcpy_s" function with another function that achieves the desired outcome. Here's an example of how you can replace it with the "strncpy" function:

```cpp
strncpy(s, driver_list::driver(jj).year, sizeof(s)-1);
s[sizeof(s)-1] = '\0'; // Manually terminate the string

// Note: It's important to specify the size of the destination buffer as the second argument of strncpy to avoid buffer overflows.
```

The "strncpy" function is a safer alternative to "strcpy_s" because it allows you to specify the maximum number of characters to copy, preventing buffer overflows. However, you need to manually terminate the string using a null character ('\0') at the end after the copying is done.

Remember to include the necessary header file for the replacement function (e.g., `<cstring>` for C++) if you haven't already.

what do lines 1 and two in GenaralSramSetting function  do?

Lines 1 and 2 in the `GenaralSramSetting` function are used to activate and deactivate the chip select signal for the external static RAM (SRAM). In line 1, the chip select signal is activated by setting GPIO pin B4 to low (`GPIOB->ODR &= ~(0x0010)`). This means that the SRAM is selected and ready to receive commands. 

In line 2, the chip select signal is deactivated by setting GPIO pin B4 to high (`GPIOB->ODR |= (0x0010)`). This means that the SRAM is no longer selected and is not able to receive any commands.

In summary, lines 1 and 2 in the `GenaralSramSetting` function activate and deactivate the chip select signal of the SRAM to indicate when the microcontroller is sending or receiving data to/from the SRAM.

The second line in the `GenaralSramSetting` function sets GPIO pin B4 low, which activates the chip select signal for the SRAM. This line of code is used to select the SRAM before sending any read or write commands to it.

can you explain to me what does GenaralSramSetting function  do line by line?

Sure! Here is a line-by-line explanation of the `GenaralSramSetting` function:

```c
void GenaralSramSetting(void){
    GPIOB->ODR |= (0x0010);
    GPIOB->ODR &= ~(0x0010);
    SPI1->DR = 0x01;    //Write STATUS register
    while((SPI1->SR & SPI_SR_BSY) == SPI_SR_BSY); //sr->flags
    SPI1->DR = 0x40;    //Sequential mode 0100_0000
    while((SPI1->SR & SPI_SR_BSY) == SPI_SR_BSY); //sr->flags
    GPIOB->ODR |= (0x0010);
}
```

- `void GenaralSramSetting(void)`: This is the function prototype for the `GenaralSramSetting` function. It takes no arguments and returns no values.

- `GPIOB->ODR |= (0x0010);`: This line sets GPIO pin B4 high, which deactivates the chip select signal for the external SRAM. This is necessary to ensure that the chip select signal is inactive before sending the write command to the SRAM.

- `GPIOB->ODR &= ~(0x0010);`: This line sets GPIO pin B4 low, which activates the chip select signal for the SRAM. This line of code is used to select the SRAM before sending any read or write commands to it.

- `SPI1->DR = 0x01;`: This line sets the data register of the SPI1 peripheral to 0x01, which corresponds to the command to write to the SRAM status register.

- `while((SPI1->SR & SPI_SR_BSY) == SPI_SR_BSY);`: This is a busy-wait loop that waits for the SPI peripheral to finish transmitting data before proceeding to the next line of code.

This corresponds to the mode in which the SRAM sends/receives a sequence of data bytes without requiring re-sending the address, which is useful in applications where large amounts of contiguous data are being read/written.

- `while((SPI1->SR & SPI_SR_BSY) == SPI_SR_BSY);`: This is another busy-wait loop that waits for the SPI peripheral to finish transmitting data before proceeding to the next line of code.

conversation.content: i have a code in vhdl can you tell me what it does?
As an AI language model, I cannot see your code or provide analysis of your code unless it is given to me. Please share your code with me so I can assist you better.

This VHDL code is for a UART (Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter) transmit module, which is used to transmit data serially. The module includes a state machine that controls the transmission of a byte of data with the start bit, 8 data bits, and stop bit. The module operates on the rising edge of the clock signal. 

The module has five states: 
- s_Idle: waits for the Tx Data Valid signal to go high 
- s_TX_Start_Bit: outputs a start bit of 0 to signal the beginning of the data, waits for the clock ticks to complete 
- s_TX_Data_Bits: outputs 8 bits of data serially, waits for the clock ticks to complete 
- s_TX_Stop_Bit: outputs a stop bit of 1 to signal the end of the data, waits for the clock ticks to complete 
- s_Cleanup: completes the transmission and resets the module 

The Tx Serial output is the data that is being transmitted serially. The Tx Active output is a signal that is high during the transmission of data. The Tx Done output is a signal that goes high when the transmission is complete. 

The transmission timing is set by the generic value g_CLKS_PER_BIT, which needs to be set according to the baud rate of the transmission. The exact value needs to be calculated using the clock frequency and desired baud rate.
please explein each section seperately

Sure, I will explain each section of the VHDL code separately:

Library and Use Clauses:
```vhdl
library ieee;
use ieee.std_logic_1164.all;
use ieee.numeric_std.all;
```

These lines include two IEEE standard libraries, *std_logic_1164* and *numeric_std*, which define the standard data types and operations for working with digital circuits and signals.

Entity Declaration:
```vhdl
entity UART_TX is
  generic (
    g_CLKS_PER_BIT : integer := 115     -- Needs to be set correctly
    );
  port (
    i_Clk       : in  std_logic;
    i_TX_DV     : in  std_logic;
    i_TX_Byte   : in  std_logic_vector(7 downto 0);
    o_TX_Active : out std_logic;
    o_TX_Serial : out std_logic;
    o_TX_Done   : out std_logic
    );
end UART_TX;
```

This section defines the entity or module *UART_TX* with a generic for the number of clock cycles per bit and input and output port declarations. The three output signals are:
- o_TX_Active: indicates when the transmission is in progress
- o_TX_Serial: the transmitted data serially
- o_TX_Done: indicates when the transmission is completed.

Architecture Section:
```vhdl
architecture RTL of UART_TX is
  type t_SM_Main is (s_Idle, s_TX_Start_Bit, s_TX_Data_Bits,
                     s_TX_Stop_Bit, s_Cleanup);
  signal r_SM_Main : t_SM_Main := s_Idle;

  signal r_Clk_Count : integer range 0 to g_CLKS_PER_BIT-1 := 0;
  signal r_Bit_Index : integer range 0 to 7 := 0;
  signal r_TX_Data   : std_logic_vector(7 downto 0) := (others => '0');
  signal r_TX_Done   : std_logic := '0';
begin
```

This section includes the architecture of the module with signals declaration. The architectural block has a defined state machine, *t_SM_Main* type enumerating the states of the machine. *r_SM_Main* signal is defined for the state of the machine. 

Other signals defined in this section are:
- r_Clk_Count: counter to keep track of the number of clock cycles
- r_Bit_Index: index of the bit being transmitted or received
- r_TX_Data: the data byte being transmitted
- r_TX_Done: indicates when the transmission is completed.

Process Statement:
```vhdl
  p_UART_TX : process (i_Clk)
  begin
    if rising_edge(i_Clk) then
      case r_SM_Main is
        ...
      end case;
    end if;
  end process p_UART_TX;
```
This process statement implements the functionality of the module. It's sensitive to the rising edge of the clock signal and includes a case statement using the state machine signals to perform the different operations of the module.

State Transitions:
```vhdl
        when s_Idle =>
          ...
          if i_TX_DV = '1' then
            ...
          else
            ...
          end if; 
        when s_TX_Start_Bit =>
          ...
          if r_Clk_Count < g_CLKS_PER_BIT-1 then
            ...
          else
            ...
          end if; 
        when s_TX_Data_Bits =>
          ...
          if r_Clk_Count < g_CLKS_PER_BIT-1 then
            ...
          else
            ...
          end if; 
        when s_TX_Stop_Bit =>
          ...
          if r_Clk_Count < g_CLKS_PER_BIT-1 then
            ...
          else
            ...
          end if; 
        when s_Cleanup =>
          ...
          if r_Clk_Count < g_CLKS_PER_BIT-1 then
            ...
          else
            ...
          end if; 
        when others =>
          r_SM_Main <= s_Idle;
```

This section defines the different transitions between the states of the state machine. Here, each state can transition into another state based on certain conditions, and actions are taken within each state.

The *s_Idle* state is the initial state where the module waits for the i_TX_DV signal to start the transmission. The transmission is started by setting the transmitted data byte (r_TX_Data) and changing the state to *s_TX_Start_Bit*.

The *s_TX_Start_Bit* state is used to send the start bit, which is 0, and then wait for g_CLKS_PER_BIT-1 clock cycles to complete the start bit transmission. After this, the state is changed to *s_TX_Data_Bits*.

The *s_TX_Data_Bits* state is where the module transmits the 8 data bits, waits for the g_CLKS_PER_BIT-1 clock cycles after transmitting each bit and increments the bit index for the next bit. Once all 8 bits have been transmitted, the state transitions to *s_TX_Stop_Bit*.

The *s_TX_Stop_Bit* state is where the module transmits the stop bit, which is 1, and then waits for g_CLKS_PER_BIT-1 clock cycles to complete the stop bit transmission. The state transitions to *s_Cleanup* once the stop bit transmission is done.

The *s_Cleanup* state is used to complete the transmission and reset the module, i.e., setting the TX_ACTIVE signal to '0' and the TX_DONE signal to '1' and changing the state back to *s_Idle*.

Output Signals:
```vhdl
  o_TX_Done <= r_TX_Done;
end RTL;
```
At the end of the architecture section, this code assigns the value of r_TX_Done to o_TX_Done, which indicates when the transmission is completed.
how many bits does it transmit?

The UART module as defined in the provided VHDL code transmits 10 bits in total:
- 1 start bit
- 8 data bits
- 1 stop bit

Each transmitted byte is preceded by a start bit of 0 and followed by a stop bit of 1. The code handles the clock cycle timing to transmit one bit at a time until all 10 bits have been transmitted according to the value defined in the generic clause g_CLKS_PER_BIT.

What are the boot loaders LILO and GRUB, and how are they used in the Linux boot process?

LILO (LInux LOader) and GRUB (GRand Unified Bootloader) are boot loaders for Linux systems that enable the booting of the Linux kernel.

LILO was the default Linux boot loader for many years until it was replaced by GRUB. LILO installs itself in the Master Boot Record (MBR) of the hard disk, and it loads the kernel from a specified location on the disk by reading the /etc/lilo.conf configuration file.

GRUB, on the other hand, has become the preferred boot loader for most Linux distributions. GRUB has several advantages over LILO, including flexibility and a more user-friendly configuration file. GRUB can be installed in either the MBR or in a partition and it offers a menu interface that allows users to select which operating system to boot from.

During the boot process, the boot loader loads the Linux kernel and any necessary modules or drivers. The kernel then loads the initial RAM disk, which contains all the necessary files and drivers to start the system. Once the system is up and running, control is handed over to the init system, which takes care of starting all the necessary system services and initializing the user environment.

Why is the Kruskall algorithm used over primms?

Kruskal's algorithm and Prim's algorithm both are used for finding the minimum spanning tree of a graph. However, they differ in their approaches to achieve the result and have their own advantages and disadvantages.

Kruskal's algorithm is a greedy algorithm that works by finding the minimum weight edge among the edges that do not form a cycle and adding it to the minimum spanning tree. This process is repeated until all vertices are included in the tree. Kruskal's algorithm works well for dense graphs where the number of edges is close to the maximum possible number of edges. Kruskal's algorithm takes O(E log V) time in the worst-case scenario.

On the other hand, Prim's algorithm is also a greedy algorithm that starts with a tree consisting of a single vertex and gradually grows by adding the minimum-weight edges that connect the tree to vertices not yet in the tree. Prim's algorithm works better for sparse graphs where the number of edges is much less than the maximum possible number of edges. Prim's algorithm takes O(E + V log V) time in the worst-case scenario.

The choice of algorithm depends on the application and the properties of the graph. For dense graphs, Kruskal’s algorithm is likely to perform better, while for sparse graphs, Prim’s algorithm is generally preferred. But in general, both Kruskal’s and Prim’s algorithms can be used to get a minimum spanning tree of a graph.

`limits.h` is a header file in C++ that defines various limits of integral types. It provides macros that contain the maximum and minimum values that can be stored in different integer data types, including `INT_MAX` which is the largest possible value for an `int` variable.

In the graph algorithms we implemented earlier, `INT_MAX` is used to initialize the key values of vertices as infinite values. This makes sure that the initial key values do not become a valid key value for any vertex during the algorithm.

Could you please help me debug?

The error you're encountering, `py4j.security.Py4JSecurityException: Method public org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD.rdd() is not whitelisted on class class org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD`, is a Py4J security exception. This suggests that the method you're attempting to call is restricted due to security settings in your PySpark environment.

The `.toJSON()` method on a DataFrame (df) ordinarily should work without issues to convert a DataFrame to a JSON-encoded string list in PySpark. However, the error indicates a deeper issue, possibly related to how PySpark and Py4J interact in your specific environment or version.

Here are some steps you can take to debug and potentially resolve the issue:

1. **Check PySpark and Py4J Versions:**
   Ensure that your PySpark and Py4J versions are compatible. Sometimes, version mismatches can lead to unexpected errors.

2. **Update PySpark (if applicable):**
   If you're not running on the latest version of PySpark compatible with your system and other dependencies, consider updating it. Newer versions may have fixes for issues that cause such security exceptions.

3. **Review SparkSession Configuration:**
   Review your SparkSession or SparkContext configuration settings. It's possible that specific security settings or configurations might be restricting certain operations. 

   If you are using a SparkSession in a restrictive environment (e.g., a corporate or shared environment), check if there are policies applying these security restrictions.

4. **Alternate Approach:**
   As a workaround, instead of using `.toJSON().collect()`, consider using the DataFrame method `.write.json("path/to/output")` to write the JSON directly to a file system without collecting it to the driver node. This approach may bypass the need to call the restricted method:

   ```python
   df.write.json("path/to/output/json")
   ```

   If you need the JSON strings in-memory for further processing within Python, consider reading back the files written, although this is less efficient than collecting directly.

5. **Consult Documentation or Seek Support:**
   If the problem persists, consult the official PySpark and Py4J documentation for any known issues or guidance. Additionally, reaching out to community forums, such as Stack Overflow, or official mailing lists/support channels might provide insights from those who have encountered similar scenarios.

6. **Minimal Reproducible Example:**
   If reaching out for further help, prepare a minimal reproducible example that highlights how you initialize your SparkSession and attempt the `.toJSON().collect()` operation. Omitting sensitive information, this can help in diagnosing the issue more effectively.

7. **Consider Security Policies:**
   In environments with strict security policies, certain methods might be intentionally blocked. If you're operating in such an environment (e.g., a managed Spark service), consult with your IT or service provider for more details on the restrictions.

Remember, the most appropriate solution can depend on the specific details of your environment, including versions, configurations, and context of use.

import TradingView/ta/5


source = hl2

length = 50


show_SR = input.bool(title='Draw Support, Mean and Resistance Zones', defval=true)
draw_targets = input.bool(title='Draw Target Labels', defval=false)
draw_sl = input.bool(title='Draw Stoploss Labels', defval=false) 
sl_pct = input.float(title='Stoploss Percentage', defval=15.0)
sl_pct_formatted = 1+(sl_pct / 100)

innermult = 2
outermult = 3

var pi = 2 * math.asin(1)
var mult = pi * innermult
var mult2 = pi * outermult
var gradsize = 0.5


SAK_smoothing(_type, _src, _length) =>
    c0 = 1.0
    c1 = 0.0
    b0 = 1.0
    b1 = 0.0
    b2 = 0.0
    a1 = 0.0
    a2 = 0.0
    alpha = 0.0
    beta = 0.0
    gamma = 0.0
    cycle = 2 * pi / _length

    alpha   := 1 / _length
    b0      := alpha
    a1      := 1 - alpha

    _Input = _src
    _Output = 0.0
    _Output := c0 * (b0 * _Input + b1 * nz(_Input[1]) + b2 * nz(_Input[2])) + a1 * nz(_Output[1]) + a2 * nz(_Output[2]) - c1 * nz(_Input[_length])
    _Output

supersmoother(_src, _length) =>
    s_a1 = math.exp(-math.sqrt(2) * pi / _length)
    s_b1 = 2 * s_a1 * math.cos(math.sqrt(2) * pi / _length)
    s_c3 = -math.pow(s_a1, 2)
    s_c2 = s_b1
    s_c1 = 1 - s_c2 - s_c3
    ss = 0.0
    ss := s_c1 * _src + s_c2 * nz(ss[1], _src[1]) + s_c3 * nz(ss[2], _src[2])
    ss

//-----------------------
// Mean Reversion Channel Function
//-----------------------
get_mrc() =>
    v_condition = 0
    v_meanline = source
    v_meanrange = supersmoother(ta.tr, length)

    v_meanline := SAK_smoothing('RMA', source, length)

    v_upband1 = v_meanline + v_meanrange * mult
    v_loband1 = v_meanline - v_meanrange * mult
    v_upband2 = v_meanline + v_meanrange * mult2
    v_loband2 = v_meanline - v_meanrange * mult2

    //-- Check Condition
    if close > v_meanline
        v_upband2_1 = v_upband2 + v_meanrange * gradsize * 4
        v_upband2_9 = v_upband2 + v_meanrange * gradsize * -4
        if high >= v_upband2_9 and high < v_upband2
            v_condition := 1
            v_condition
        else if high >= v_upband2 and high < v_upband2_1
            v_condition := 2
            v_condition
        else if high >= v_upband2_1
            v_condition := 3
            v_condition
        else if close <= v_meanline + v_meanrange
            v_condition := 4
            v_condition
        else
            v_condition := 5
            v_condition

    if close < v_meanline
        v_loband2_1 = v_loband2 - v_meanrange * gradsize * 4
        v_loband2_9 = v_loband2 - v_meanrange * gradsize * -4
        if low <= v_loband2_9 and low > v_loband2
            v_condition := -1
            v_condition
        else if low <= v_loband2 and low > v_loband2_1
            v_condition := -2
            v_condition
        else if low <= v_loband2_1
            v_condition := -3
            v_condition
        else if close >= v_meanline + v_meanrange
            v_condition := -4
            v_condition
        else
            v_condition := -5
            v_condition

    [v_meanline, v_meanrange, v_upband1, v_loband1, v_upband2, v_loband2, v_condition]

import math
import numpy as np

def SAK_smoothing(_type, _src, _length):
    c0 = 1.0
    c1 = 0.0
    b0 = 1.0
    b1 = 0.0
    b2 = 0.0
    a1 = 0.0
    a2 = 0.0
    alpha = 0.0
    beta = 0.0
    gamma = 0.0
    cycle = 2 * np.pi / _length

    alpha = 1 / _length
    b0 = alpha
    a1 = 1 - alpha

    _Input = _src
    _Output = np.zeros(len(_src))
    for i in range(len(_src)):
        _Output[i] = c0 * (b0 * _Input[i] + b1 * np.nan_to_num(_Input[i-1]) + b2 * np.nan_to_num(_Input[i-2])) + a1 * np.nan_to_num(_Output[i-1]) + a2 * np.nan_to_num(_Output[i-2]) - c1 * np.nan_to_num(_Input[i - _length])
    return _Output

def supersmoother(_src, _length):
    s_a1 = np.exp(-np.sqrt(2) * np.pi / _length)
    s_b1 = 2 * s_a1 * np.cos(np.sqrt(2) * np.pi / _length)
    s_c3 = -np.power(s_a1, 2)
    s_c2 = s_b1
    s_c1 = 1 - s_c2 - s_c3
    ss = np.zeros(len(_src))
    for i in range(len(_src)):
        ss[i] = s_c1 * _src[i] + s_c2 * np.nan_to_num(ss[i-1], _src[i-1]) + s_c3 * np.nan_to_num(ss[i-2], _src[i-2])
    return ss

def get_mrc():

    v_meanline = source
    v_meanrange = supersmoother(ta.tr, length)

    v_meanline = SAK_smoothing('RMA', source, length)

    v_upband1 = v_meanline + v_meanrange * mult
    v_loband1 = v_meanline - v_meanrange * mult
    v_upband2 = v_meanline + v_meanrange * mult2
    v_loband2 = v_meanline - v_meanrange * mult2

        elif high >= v_upband2_1:

        elif close <= v_meanline + v_meanrange:

        else:

    if close < v_meanline:
        v_loband2_1 = v_loband2 - v_meanrange * gradsize * 4
        v_loband2_9 = v_loband2 - v_meanrange * gradsize * -4
        if low <= v_loband2_9 and low > v_loband2:
            v_condition = -1
        elif low <= v_loband2 and low > v_loband2_1:
            v_condition = -2
        elif low <= v_loband2_1:
            v_condition = -3
        elif close >= v_meanline + v_meanrange:
            v_condition = -4
        else:
            v_condition = -5

    return v_meanline, v_meanrange, v_upband1, v_loband1, v_upband2, v_loband2, v_condition

def gen_filename(fid, min_chars=1, charset=string.ascii_letters + string.digits):
	digits = []

	# Can't divide 0

import c4d
import math
import random
from c4d import Vector as Vector
class rrtVert:
    def __init__(self, pos):
        self.pos = pos
        self.connection = -1
        self.done = False
        
    def getDone(self):
        return self.done
    
    def setDone(self,status):
        self.done = status
        
    def addConnection(self, conn):
        self.connection = conn
        
    def getConnection(self):
        return self.connection
    
    def getPos(self):
        return self.pos
    
class Settings:
    def __init__(self,obj):
        self.step_size     = obj[c4d.ID_USERDATA, 1]
        self.source_obj    = obj[c4d.ID_USERDATA, 2]
        self.target_obj    = obj[c4d.ID_USERDATA, 3]
        self.branch_radius = obj[c4d.ID_USERDATA, 4]
        self.twoD          = obj[c4d.ID_USERDATA, 5]
        self.branchiness   = obj[c4d.ID_USERDATA, 6]
        self.seed          = obj[c4d.ID_USERDATA, 7]
        self.max_steps     = obj[c4d.ID_USERDATA, 8]
def find_nearest_neighbour(verts, point):
    closest = 1
    smallest_dist = float("inf")
    for i, v in enumerate(verts):
        vert = v.getPos()
        dist = (vert - point).GetLength()
        if dist < smallest_dist:
            closest = i
            smallest_dist = dist
    return closest
    
def get_random_point(target, minPos, maxPos, settings, progress):

    return next_x, next_y, next_z

def create_path(settings):
